title: Design and Utilization of an Online Learning Satisfaction Prediction Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics, machine learning concepts, and Python programming
context.additional_context: Learners have basic online learning experience but limited artificial neural network model design experience. Blended classes combine theoretical lectures with practical sessions, focusing on model implementation using real datasets

learning_goals: Learners can explain the structure of an artificial neural network (ANN)-based predictive model and apply it to training data.
Learners can identify factors influencing online learning satisfaction (e.g., self-efficacy, instructional quality) and map them to a dataset.
Learners can design an ANN model achieving over 90% prediction accuracy through data preprocessing, feature selection, and model optimization.
Learners can quantitatively evaluate model performance by interpreting the confusion matrix and TPR/TNR metrics.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
